00050 // -------------------------------------- PUBLIC MACROS ---------------------------------------------
00051 
00052 /* Options of the test program */
00053 #define M_PAR_VALID_INPUT_FILE 'L' /**< input file flag*/
00054 #define M_PAR_LIG_NEIG_DIST 'd' /**< ligand neighbour distance flag*/
00055 #define M_PAR_P_STATS_OUT 'o' /**< output prefix (particular) flag*/
00056 #define M_PAR_G_STATS_OUT 'e' /**< general output prefix flag*/
00057 #define M_PAR_KEEP_FP_OUTPUT 'k' /**< flag to keep the fpocket output*/
00058 
00059 
00060 /* Write the statistics output of tpocket to : */
00061 #define M_STATS_OUTP "stats_p.txt" /**< standard per pocket output name*/
00062 #define M_STATS_OUTG "stats_g.txt" /**< standard general output name*/
00063 #define M_MAX_FILE_NAME_LENGTH 300 /**< max filename length */
00064 /* #define M_PAR_P_STATS_OUT 'o' */
00065 /* in order to get the atom set of the pocket, detect around x A of the ligand*/
00066 #define M_LIG_NEIG_DIST 4.0 /**< ligand neighbour distance for explicit pocket definition*/
00067 
00068 #define M_TP_USAGE "\
00069 \n***** USAGE (tpocket) *****\n\
00070 \n\
00071 The program needs as input a file containing at each                 \n\
00072 line a pdb file name (apo + complexe), a ligand code                 \n\
00073 (3 letters), all separeted by a tabulation.                          \n\
00074 The format of each line must therefore be:                           \n\n\
00075 {PATH/}APO.pdb  {PATH/}HOLO.pdb  LIG.                                \n\n\
00076 The ligand code is the resname of the ligand atoms in                \n\
00077 the pdb file of the HOLO form of the protein.                        \n\n\
00078 See the manual for more information.                                 \n\n\
00079 Example of command using default parameters:                         \n\
00080 \t./bin/tpocket -L file_path                                         \n\n\
00081 Options:                                                             \n\
00082 \t-e string  : Write global performance to this file                 \n\
00083 \t             Default name: ./stats_g.txt.           (./stats_g.txt)\n\
00084 \t-o string  : Write pocket detailed statistics to .                 \n\
00085 \t             this file Default name: ./stats_p.txt  (./stats_p.txt)\n\
00086 \t-d float   : Distance criteria for the 2 ways to                   \n\
00087 \t             define the actual pocket               (4.0)          \n\n\
00088 Options specific to fpocket are usable too.\n\
00089 See the manual/documentation for mor information.\n\
00090 ***************************\n" /**< output for the tpocket usage*/
00091 
00092 /* --------------------------- PUBLIC STRUCTURES -----------------------------*/
00093 
00094 /**
00095  Container of the tpocket parameters
00096 */
00097 typedef struct s_tparams
00098 {
00099         char **fapo,    /**< path to the apo structure*/
00100                  **fcomplex, /**< path to the holo structure*/
00101                  **fligan; /**< name of the ligand residue*/
00102         
00103         char *p_output; /**< per pocket output path*/
00104         char *g_output; /**< general output path*/
00105         
00106         char stats_g[128] ; /* M_STATS_OUTG */
00107         char stats_p[128] ; /* M_STATS_OUTP */
00108 
00109         float lig_neigh_dist ; /**< ligand neighbour dist for explicit pocket definition */
00110         int nfiles ; /**< number of files to analyze*/
00111         int keep_fpout ; /**< keep the fpocket output (flag)*/
00112 
00113 /* Parameters for the pocket finder program (also needed for validation program...) */
00114 
00115         s_fparams *fpar ; /**< fpocket parameter container*/
00116 
00117 } s_tparams ;
00118 
00119 /* ------------------------------ PROTOTYPES ---------------------------------*/
00120 
00121 s_tparams* init_def_tparams(void) ;
00122 s_tparams* get_tpocket_args(int nargs, char **args) ;
00123 int add_list_data(char *str_list_file, s_tparams *par) ;
00124 int add_prot(char *apo, char *complex, char *ligan, s_tparams *par) ;
00125 int parse_lig_neigh_dist(char *str, s_tparams *p) ;
00126 
00127 void free_tparams(s_tparams *p);
00128 void print_test_usage(FILE *f) ;
00129 void print_params(s_tparams *p, FILE *f) ;

00131 #endif
